titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Margaret Croyden Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:11

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Margaret Croyden papers contain writings, research material, photographs, audiovisual material, and personal papers. Writings include drafts, printed versions, and photocopies of printed versions of reviews and essays on theater-related topics as well as corrected drafts of her fourth book, The Years in Between (Xlibris, 2011). Video recordings appear to date chiefly from Croyden's tenure with the CBS TV series Camera Three during the 1970s. There are audio recordings and other materials relating to theater director Peter Brook and possibly to Croyden's Conversations with Peter Brook: 1970-2000 (Theatre Communications Group, 2003). Other materials in the collection include clippings, computer disks, correspondence, photographs, a laptop, and slides.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Locus Solus Rare Books on the Elizabeth Wakeman Dwight Memorial Fund, 2005. Additional material received in 2011. Gift of Ron Melk and Phyliss Dain, 2015.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 12, 17, 34, and 36 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 6-11, 16, 35, 38 and 39 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 37: Restricted until 2066. For further information consult appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Margaret Croyden Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Margaret Croyden Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization upon acquisition. Further organization and description were carried out in 2014-2016. Descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing of the collection at the time of acquisition.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Margaret Croyden
bioghist.p: Margaret Croyden, American theater critic and journalist and host of the television program Camera Three. In addition to shorter works on the theater, her major publications include Lunatics, Lovers, & Poets: The Contemporary Experimental Theatre (1974), the memoir In the Shadow of the Flame: Three Journeys (1993), Conversations with Peter Brook: 1970-2000 (2003), and The Years In Between: A Reporter's Journey World War II--The Cold War (2011).
Biographical information taken from "Margaret Croyden." Contemporary Authors Online . Detroit: Gale, 2004. Gale Biography In Context . Web. 29 Feb. 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Margaret Croyden papers contain writings, research material, photographs, audiovisual material, and personal papers. Writings contain drafts and printed versions and photocopies (of printed versions) of reviews and essays on theater related topics as well as corrected drafts of her fourth book, The Years in between (2011). Video appears to date chiefly to Croyden's tenure with the CBS TV series Camera Three during the 1970s. There are audio recordings and other materials relating to Peter Brook, possibly to Croyden's Conversations with Peter Brook: 1970-2000 (2003). Other materials in the collection include clippings, computer disks, correspondence, photographs, a laptop, and slides.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three groupings: November 2005 Acquisition, 2011 Addition to November 2005 Acquisition, and December 2015 Acquisition.

Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time. Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. For instance, correspondence and writings can be found in all three groupings. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.
Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material arranged as received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A letter, dated 1994-04-04, included with the tape reads: Dear Ms. Croyden [It] was pleasure meeting you again. We were delighted by your performance on our show. It was very interesting hearing about your family, your life and your adventures. You must come back again to talk about your New York experiences with the "avant garde". All the best, Susan Haskins, Inside Broadway

did.unittitle: "'Jerzy Grotowski: 1973', Creative Arts Television, Kent CT"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There is a write-up on Jerzy Grotowski on the back of the tape. It reads: Jerzy Growtowski: 1973 In this episode of "Conversations About Theater" Jerzy Grotowski speaks with Margaret Croyden, well known American theater critic and author of "Lunatics, Lovers and Poets: The Contemporary Experimental Theater". His translator is Jacques Chwat. This interview was recorded in 1973. Grotowski had recenty returned from several months of vagabonding around the United States. He discusses his personal changes and new persepectives for his Polish Laboratory Theater. Copyright: 2006, Creative Arts Television

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in loose groupings by format as received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The December 2015 Addition documents the personal and professional life of Margaret Croyden. Typed and photocopied drafts of Croyden's manuscripts "Farewell Mr. Hemingway", "The Years in Between: A Reporter's Journey", and other works are included in the addition, as is her correspondence wtih literary agents and publishers. Press files concerning the publication of her books "In the Shadow of the Flame," "Conversations with Peter Brook (1970- 2000)," and "The Years In Between: A Reporter's Journey" are also included. The addition also contains copies of her column "Croyden's Corner", her reviews in the New York Theater Wire, and other publications; Croyden's notes as a student and a teacher; and notes from her travels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I includes manuscript drafts of Croyden's works; correspondence with literary agents and publishers; press release information for books; and book proposals.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I is arranged in loose groupings by format as recieved by the library.

arrangement.p: Series II is arranged in loose groupings by format as recieved by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II includes Croyden's personal diaries, planners, and correspondence. Also included are documents pertaining to her name change and the deaths of her sister and father.

did.unittitle: Correspondence (note: with typed manuscript writing on one letter)
Sylvia Rosenberg documents and father's death certificate

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series III is arranged in loose groupings by format as recieved by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III contains theater reviews and other materials related to Croyden's career as a theater critic. Included are reviews posted in "Croyden's Corner" in the New York Theater Wire. Also included are issues of Theater Week and American Theatre, which published Croyden's reviews. One issue of AI: Performance for the Planet is also included. Other files pertain to Croyden's study of Jerzy Grotowski, Peter Brook, and other theater luminaries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series IV is arranged in loose groupings by format as recieved by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV contains Croyden's notes from classes during her undergraduate career at Hunter College; teaching notes from her position as a professor of English literature at Jersey City State University; and students' papers.

did.unittitle: Notes from Studies in Modern British and American Literature class
Notes from English Social History class
Notes from 18th century novel, English Poetry and English Drama, classes
Various class notes and term papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file includes notes and essays from the following classes: Comptemporary American and British Fiction, 1963; The Georgians and The Edwardians, 1965; Restoration Drama and Eighteenth Century Theatre, 1966; and The Age of Dryden and Pope, undated.

did.unittitle: Hunter College documents and other school files

Oral Report on Franz Kafka for Croyden's class

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series V is arranged in loose groupings by format recieved by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V includes Croyden's travel journals, travel brochures, and tourist information. Also included are business cards and contact information for businesses and individuals from various cities.

did.unittitle: Berlin notebook, business cards, and notes
Florence, Bologna, and Rome business cards and notes
Berlin, Budapest, and Prague notes and business cards

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series VI is arranged in loose groupings by format as recieved by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series VI contains posters and photographs. The posters are from productions directed by Peter Brook and Jerzy Grotowski. The three photographs included are of Peter Brook, Jerzy Grotowski, and Margaret Croyden with an unidentified man.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The box contains student papers graded by Croyden.
